greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of Dyck paths of semilength n avoiding the consecutive step pattern given by the binary expansion of k, where 1=U=(1,1) and 0=D=(1,-1); square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; local b, m, r, h;
proc(x, y, t) option remember; `if`(y<0 or y>x, 0, `if`(x=0, 1,
`if`(t=m and r=0, 0, b(x-1, y-1, irem(2*t, h)))))
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = Module[{b, m, r, h}, If[k<2, Return[If[n == 0, 1, 0]]]; {m, r} = QuotientRemainder[k, 2]; h = 2^Floor[Log[2, k]]; b[x_, y_, t_] := b[x, y, t] = If[y<0 || y>x, 0, If[x == 0, 1, If[t == m && r == 1, 0, b[x-1, y+1, Mod[2*t+1, h]]] + If[t == m && r == 0, 0, b[x-1, y-1, Mod[2*t, h]]]]]; b[2*n, 0, 0]]; Table[ Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 27 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Main diagonal gives A243754 or column k=0 of A243752.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 09 2014
